00008 PhysicsManager* PhysicsManager::getInstance() {
00009     if (pinstance != NULL) {
00010         return pinstance;
00011     } else {

00017 void PhysicsManager::loop() {
00018     while (1) {
00019         //Add any objects that need to be added
00020         SDL_SemWait(objectsToAddSem); //Only access this data if there isn't a lock on it, otherwise just skip it
00021         while (!objectsToAdd.empty()) {
00022             objects.insert(objectsToAdd.top());
00023             objectsToAdd.pop();
00024         }
00025         SDL_SemPost(objectsToAddSem);
00026 
00027         //Remove any objects that need to be removed
00028         SDL_SemWait(objectsToDeleteSem); //Only access this data if there isn't a lock on it, otherwise just skip it
00029         while (!objectsToDelete.empty()) {
00030             std::map<int, PhysicsObject*>::iterator iter = objects.find(objectsToDelete.top());
00031             objectsToAdd.pop();
00032             if (iter != objects.end()) {
00033                 objects.erase(iter);
00034             }
00035         }
00036         SDL_SemPost(objectsToDeleteSem);
00037 
00038         //Now just update everything individually
00039         int currentTime = SDLLoader::getTime();
00040         //First update the positions
00041         for (int i = lastUpdated - lastUpdated%10; i < currentTime - currentTime%10; i+= 10) {
00042             for (std::map<int, PhysicsObject*>::iterator iter = objects.begin(); iter != objects.end(); iter++) {
00043                 iter->second->updateTick(10);
00044                 //Check collisions
00045                 for (std::map<int, PhysicsObject*>::iterator iter2 = objects.begin(); iter2 != objects.end(); iter2++) {
00046                     if (iter != iter2) {
00047                         if (checkCollisions(iter->second, iter2->second) != 0) {
00048                             iter->second->resetPosition(currentTime);
00049                             iter2->second->resetPosition(currentTime);
00050                         }
00051                     }
00052                 }
00053             }
00054             //currentTime = SDLLoader::getTime();
00055         }
00056         //Now update the velocities and accelerations of everything
00057         for (std::map<int, PhysicsObject*>::iterator iter = objects.begin(); iter != objects.end(); iter++) {
00058             iter->second->updateVel(currentTime);
00059             iter->second->updateAcc(currentTime);
00060             //Check for dead forces and clear them out
00061             for (std::map<int, Path<Point3> >::iterator i = iter->second->forces.begin(); i != iter->second->forces.end(); i++) {
00062                 if (i->second.getIsFinished() == true) {
00063                     //printf("PhysicsObject::removed a dead force\n");
00064                     //forces.erase(i);
00065                 }
00066             }
00067             iter->second->lastUpdated = currentTime;
00068         }
00069         lastUpdated = currentTime;
00070     }
00071 }
00072 
00073 int PhysicsManager::addObject(PhysicsObject* toAdd) {
00074     SDL_SemWait(objectsToAddSem);
00075     PhysicsManager::getInstance()->objectsToAdd.push(std::pair<int, PhysicsObject*>(currentIdNumber, toAdd));
00076     currentIdNumber++;
00077     SDL_SemPost(objectsToAddSem);
00078     return currentIdNumber -1;
00079 }
00080 
00081 void PhysicsManager::deleteObject(int idNum) {
00082     SDL_SemWait(objectsToDeleteSem);
00083     objectsToDelete.push(idNum);
00084     SDL_SemPost(objectsToDeleteSem);
00085 }

00087 int PhysicsManager::checkCollisions() {
00088     int numCollisions = 0;
00089     //for (std::map<int, PhysicsObject*>::iterator iter1 = objects.begin(); iter1 != objects.end(); iter1++) {
00090     std::map<int, PhysicsObject*>::iterator iter1 = objects.begin();
00091         for (std::map<int, PhysicsObject*>::iterator iter2 = objects.begin(); iter2 != objects.end(); iter2++) {
00092             if (iter1 != iter2) {
00093                 if ((iter1->second->pos - iter2->second->pos).getMag() <= 2) {
00094                     //Then a collision occurred
00095                     printf("Collision occured!\n");
00096                     printf("Velocity now is %f, %f, %f\n", iter1->second->vel.x, iter1->second->vel.y, iter1->second->vel.z);
00097                     iter1->second->vel = iter1->second->vel*-1;
00098                     printf("Velocity now is %f, %f, %f\n", iter1->second->vel.x, iter1->second->vel.y, iter1->second->vel.z);
00099                     iter2->second->vel = iter2->second->vel*-1;
00100                 }
00101             }
00102         }
00103     //}
00104 }
00105 
00106 int PhysicsManager::checkCollisions(int physObjId) {
00107     int numCollisions = 0;
00108     std::map<int, PhysicsObject*>::iterator iter1 = objects.find(physObjId);
00109     for (std::map<int, PhysicsObject*>::iterator iter2 = objects.begin(); iter2 != objects.end(); iter2++) {
00110         if (iter1 != iter2) {
00111             if ((iter1->second->center - iter2->second->center).getMagSquared() <= 4) {
00112                 //Then a collision occurred
00113                 PhysicsObject* ball1 = iter1->second;
00114                 PhysicsObject* ball2 = iter2->second;
00115 
00116                 //There are really two velocities per ball - the part pointing directly at the other ball, and the part pointing perpendicular to the first part. These shall be called effecVel and perpVel, respectively.
00117                 Point3 displacement = (ball1->center - ball2->center).getUnit();
00118                 Point3 effecVel1 = displacement * Point3::dot(ball1->vel,displacement);
00119                 Point3 effecVel2 = displacement * Point3::dot(ball2->vel,displacement);
00120                 Point3 perpVel1 = ball1->vel - effecVel1;
00121                 Point3 perpVel2 = ball2->vel - effecVel2;
00122 
00123                 /*
00124                 Point3 momentum = iter1->second->vel * iter1->second->mass + iter2->second->vel * iter2->second->mass;
00125                 Point3 direction2 = (iter2->second->pos - iter1->second->pos).getUnit();
00126                 iter2->second->vel = (direction2 * momentum.getMag()) / iter2->second->mass;
00127                 iter1->second->vel = (momentum - iter2->second->vel * iter2->second->mass) / iter1->second->mass;
00128                 */
00129                 ball1->vel = (effecVel1 * ((ball1->mass - ball2->mass)/(ball1->mass + ball2->mass))) + (effecVel2 * ((2 * ball2->mass)/(ball1->mass + ball2->mass))) * 1.0 + perpVel1;
00130                 ball2->vel = (effecVel2 * ((ball2->mass - ball1->mass)/(ball1->mass + ball2->mass))) + (effecVel1 * ((2 * ball1->mass)/(ball1->mass + ball2->mass))) * 1.0 + perpVel2;
00131 
00132                 numCollisions++;
00133             }
00134         }
00135     }
00136     return numCollisions;
00137 }
00138 
00139 int PhysicsManager::checkCollisions(PhysicsObject* obj1, PhysicsObject* obj2) {
00140     int numCollisions = 0;
00141     if ((obj1->center - obj2->center).getMagSquared() <= obj1->radius*obj1->radius + obj2->radius*obj2->radius) {
00142         //Then a collision occurred
00143         //Error::debug("PhysicsManager::Collision occurred!\n    Positions are <%f, %f, %f> and <%f, %f, %f>");
00144         //There are really two velocities per obj - the part pointing directly at the other obj, and the part pointing perpendicular to the first part. These shall be called effecVel and perpVel, respectively.
00145         Point3 displacement = (obj1->center - obj2->center).getUnit();
00146         Point3 effecVel1 = displacement * Point3::dot(obj1->vel,displacement);
00147         Point3 effecVel2 = displacement * Point3::dot(obj2->vel,displacement);
00148         Error::debug("effecVel = <%f, %f, %f>\n", effecVel1.x, effecVel1.y, effecVel1.z);
00149         Point3 perpVel1 = obj1->vel - effecVel1;
00150         Point3 perpVel2 = obj2->vel - effecVel2;
00151 
00152         /*
00153         Point3 momentum = obj1->vel * obj1->mass + obj2->vel * obj2->mass;
00154         Point3 direction2 = (obj2->pos - obj1->pos).getUnit();
00155         obj2->vel = (direction2 * momentum.getMag()) / obj2->mass;
00156         obj1->vel = (momentum - obj2->vel * obj2->mass) / obj1->mass;
00157         */
00158         obj1->vel = (effecVel1 * ((obj1->mass - obj2->mass)/(obj1->mass + obj2->mass))) + (effecVel2 * ((2 * obj2->mass)/(obj1->mass + obj2->mass))) * 0.8 + perpVel1;
00159         obj2->vel = (effecVel2 * ((obj2->mass - obj1->mass)/(obj1->mass + obj2->mass))) + (effecVel1 * ((2 * obj1->mass)/(obj1->mass + obj2->mass))) * 0.8 + perpVel2;
00160 
00161         numCollisions++;
00162     }
00163     return numCollisions;
00164 }
